summary: This FBI 302 documents an interview with BOP Lieutenant Doctor on August 10, 2019, regarding a review of Jeffrey Epstein's inmate records and activities at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following his death. It details anomalies in his phone records, including an unrecorded call he made on August 9, 2019, and provides information about his commissary funds, lack of visitors, and last cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose records are being reviewed. The document details his phone activity, commissary funds, and lack of visitors prior to his death.

persons.name: Lieutenant Doctor
persons.context: A Bureau of Prisons (BOP) lieutenant who provided the reporting investigator with a review of Jeffrey Epstein's inmate records and activity, including details about phone calls and commissary.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bullock
persons.context: A BOP supervisor who reported and provided details about an unsecured phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Listed as Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, who was notified of his death by BOP personnel at 1100 hours on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate at the MCC, who was released from court on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Michael Owen Gildea Jr.
persons.context: The FBI special agent who drafted this FD-302 report on August 13, 2019, documenting the interview with BOP Lieutenant Doctor.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is listed as Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, whom BOP personnel notified of his death.
Efrain Reyes was Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate at the MCC before being released on August 9, 2019.
Both are BOP personnel involved in the management and reporting of inmate Jeffrey Epstein's records and activities.
FBI Special Agent Gildea interviewed BOP Lieutenant Doctor and documented the information in this FD-302 report.

events.title: Epstein's Unsecured Phone Call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made an unrecorded, unsecured phone call (on a 'legal line') from the MCC. He told BOP supervisor Nathaniel Bullock there was an issue with his phone account, preventing a normal call.

events.title: Release of Cellmate Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate, was released from court.

events.title: Death Notification to Next of Kin
events.description: BOP personnel notified Jeffrey Epstein's next of kin, Mark Epstein, of his death at 1100 hours.

events.title: FBI Interview with BOP Lieutenant
events.description: The reporting investigator (FBI) met with BOP Lieutenant Doctor to review Jeffrey Epstein's inmate records and activity following his death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made an unrecorded, unsecured phone call on August 9, 2019, claiming he could not make a normal call due to an account issue. He reportedly told BOP staff he was calling his deceased mother.
Epstein had no recorded phone calls on file with the BOP system, which Lt. Doctor found odd given the known call on August 9. A test on another inmate confirmed the system was working.
Epstein had $566.27 in his commissary account at the time of his death, no authorized persons on his call log, and no recorded visitors to the MCC.
His last cellmate was Efrain Reyes, who was released from court on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.
The FBI 302 report was drafted by Special Agent Michael Owen Gildea Jr. on August 13, 2019, documenting an interview conducted on August 10, 2019.
